Name: Phnom Penh
Description: Phnom Penh, at the confluence of the Mekong and the Tonle Sap Rivers, is the capital of Cambodia and its largest city.

Name: Banlung
Description: Banlung (បានលុង), although a small town, is the capital of Ratanakiri Province in Eastern Cambodia.

Name: Battambang
Description: Battambang [dead link] is Cambodia's second most populous city, and a popular tourist destination due to the many nearby ancient temples, Buddhist shrines and the infamous bamboo railway. It is also the capital of Battambang Province.

Name: Kampot
Description: Kampot is a small town (pop.~40,000) in southeast Cambodia and capital of the province of the same name. It is a gateway to Bokor National Park

Name: Koh Kong
Description: Koh Kong, or Krong Khemarak Phoumin, is the capital of Koh Kong Province in Cambodia's  Cardamom Mountains. It is 8 km from Cham Yeam, which is connected by Cambodia's southernmost Thai border crossing to the Thai town of Hat Lek.

Name: Kompong Thom
Description: Kampong Thom is the capital of Kampong Thom Province in Cambodia. It's about halfway between Phnom Penh and Siem Reap and thus most travellers only rush through on their way between these two major attractions.

Name: Kratie
Description: Kratie (ក្រចេះ, pronounced kra-chey) is a tiny town in northeastern Cambodia. Despite its small size, it is the capital of the province of the same name.

Name: Siem Reap
Description: The town of Siem Reap (សៀមរាប), in northern Cambodia, is the primary access point for the Angkor Archaeological Park.

Name: Sihanoukville
Description: Sihanoukville (Krong Preah Seihanu), formerly Kompong Som and familiarly just Snookyville or even Snooky is a seaside town featuring Cambodia's best-known beaches.

Name: Bokor National Park
Description: Bokor National Park is in Cambodia.

Name: Kampong Cham
Description: Kampong Cham is the seventh largest city in Cambodia and the capital of the province of the same name.

Name: Kep
Description: Kep is a seaside resort area in Cambodia and includes the small town of the same name which is the capital of Kep Province.

Name: Krek
Description: Krek (also known as Kraek; pronounced as cry-eek) is a town in the Mekong Lowlands and Central Plains region of Cambodia.

Name: Koh Ker
Description: Koh Ker is to the north of Siem Reap, Cambodia.

Name: Poipet
Description: Poipet hosts Cambodia's main border crossing with Thailand, which links northwest Cambodia to Aranyaprathet, and hence Bangkok. Cross-border activity has made the town grow to be larger than its provincial capital, Sisophon.

Name: Preah Vihear
Description: Prasat Preah Vihear (ព្រះវិហារ) is a Khmer (Cambodian) temple crowning a 525-m cliff in the Dângrêk Mountains in Cambodia, across the border from Si Saket and Kantharalak in northeastern Thailand. It is also the name of the surrounding province.

Name: Tonle Sap Lake
Description: Tonle Sap Lake is in Cambodia.
